required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of Mircera (Methoxy Polyethylene Glycol-epoetin Beta) in Anemic Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease (NORM)
clinical_study.official_title: Non-Interventional Study to Document the Efficacy in Routine Clinical Practice of Mircera in Pakistan (NORM)

brief_summary.textblock: This observational, prospective, multi-centre, single-arm study will evaluate the efficacy of Mircera (methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta) in patients with chronic kidney disease previously on treatment with short-acting epoetin alpha. Data will be collected for 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Maintaining Hemoglobin (Hb) Levels Between 11-12 Gram Per Deciliter (g/dL) During Final 2 Months of Study

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Achieve Hb Level to 11-12 g/dL
Number of Dose Adjustments Required to Maintain Hb Levels
Number of Doses of Mircera Taken as Per the Schedule in Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC)

intervention.description: Participants with chronic kidney disease receiving methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta (Mircera) and previously on treatment with short-acting epoetin alpha will be observed for a period of 6 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, age 18 years or above
- Chronic kidney disease (CKD) with anemia
- Patients on dialysis receiving short-acting epoetin (EPO)
- Serum ferritin level >/=100 ng/ml or transferrin saturation (TSAT) >/=20%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients unwilling to give informed consent
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- Transfusion of red blood cells within 8 weeks of the start of Mircera treatment
- Relevant acute or chronic bleeding history
- Hemolysis
- Hemoglobinopathies
- Pure red cell aplasia

facility.name: Sheikh Zayed Hospital; Department of Nephrology
Northwest General Hospital; Department of Nephrology

group.title: Mircera
group.description: Participants with chronic kidney disease receiving methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta (Mircera) and previously on treatment with short-acting epoetin alpha were observed for a period of 6 months.

baseline.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) analysis set included all participants who were enrolled in the study. Age (continuous) data were reported only for treated participants.

group.title: Mircera
group.description: Participants with chronic kidney disease receiving methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta (Mircera) and previously on treatment with short-acting epoetin alpha were observed for a period of 6 months.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Number of participants analyzed for this baseline characteristic were 21, as the age data were available only for treated participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Maintaining Hemoglobin (Hb) Levels Between 11-12 Gram Per Deciliter (g/dL) During Final 2 Months of Study
outcome.population: None of the enrolled participants in the study achieved Hb level between 11 to 12 g/dL during the final 2 months of study, therefore this particular endpoint was not analyzed.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: As none of the enrolled participants in the study achieved the endpoint of maintaining Hb level between 11-12 g/dL during the final 2 months of study, therefore efficacy parameters were not analyzed.
